meanings.definition: In a dopy manner; sluggishly or lazily.
meanings.sent1: She walked dopily to the store, taking her time.
meanings.sent2: The cat moved dopily across the room, not in a hurry.
meanings.sent3: After staying up late, he dopily tried to focus on his homework.
meanings.sent4: The old car chugged dopily up the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The sloth moved dopily through the trees, enjoying its slow pace.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of alertness or awareness; drowsily.
meanings.sent1: The dopily student struggled to stay awake during the lecture.
meanings.sent2: The dog looked dopily at its owner, half-asleep.
meanings.sent3: She dopily tried to remember where she left her keys, still half-asleep.
meanings.sent4: The dopily cat napped in the warm sun, oblivious to its surroundings.
meanings.sent5: His dopily expression showed he had just woken up from a nap.
